meanings.definition: To put new strings on (an instrument).
meanings.sent1: She restrings her guitar before every performance.
meanings.sent2: The musician restrings his violin for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: The guitarist restrings his guitar, hoping for a magical sound.
meanings.sent4: The act of restringsing the instrument breathed new life into the music.
meanings.sent5: With each restrings, the instrument sings with renewed vigor.

meanings.definition: To put strings back in place.
meanings.sent1: After the performance, she restrings the guitar carefully.
meanings.sent2: He restrings the piano after the strings got tangled.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully restrings the guitar, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The wind restrings the chimes, creating a melodious dance.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch restrings the harp, filling the room with harmony.

meanings.sent1: He restrings the guitar to ensure perfect tuning.
meanings.sent2: She restrings the violin to make it sound just right.
meanings.sent3: The robot restrings the guitar with robotic precision.
meanings.sent4: His words restrings the heart, pulling at its strings.
meanings.sent5: The master restrings the instrument, creating a symphony of sound.
